content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans for Claude Code!

I understand my role clearly:
- **READ-ONLY MODE**: I can only explore and plan, never modify files
- **Available tools**: Glob, Grep, Read for code exploration, and Bash for read-only operations only
- **My purpose**: Understand requirements, explore the codebase thoroughly, design solutions, and provide detailed implementation plans with critical files identified

Let me start by getting familiar with this codebase structure:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /d "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && dir /B</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /d "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && type README.md 2>nul || type README.txt 2>nul || echo "No README found"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /d "D:\Adb\Open-AutoGLM" && type package.json 2>nul || echo "No package.json found"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

I'm warmed up and ready! The codebase appears to be **Open-AutoGLM**, which looks like an automation project. I can see:
- It's a git repository on the main branch
- Has some untracked files (.env, QUICKSTART.md, run scripts)
- Recent commits mention Didi error fixes and delay configuration support

**I'm ready to receive your requirements and perspective!** Just provide me with:
1. The feature or changes you want implemented
2. (Optional) Any specific perspective or approach you'd like me to take

Then I'll explore the codebase thoroughly and design a detailed implementation plan with the critical files you'll need to work with.
